definitions.definition: To believe ; to put credence in.
examples: Someone said there were over 100,000 people there, but I can't credit that.
Credit accounts receivable with the amount of the invoice.
For the payroll period credit employees' tips to their wages paid account and debit their minimum wage payable account.
The full amount of the purchase has been credited to your account.
I credit the town council with restoring the shopping district.
Credit the point guard with another assist.

definitions.definition: To bring honour or repute upon; to do credit to; to raise the estimation of.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To believe ; to put credence in.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , accounting ) To add to an account.
( transitive ) To acknowledge the contribution of.
( transitive ) To bring honour or repute upon; to do credit to; to raise the estimation of.
